title: Crypto-Lender Nexo Nears Acquisition of Peter Thiel-Backed Lender Vauld; Deal comes after Vauld suspended withdrawals amid capital flight
text:
The crypto market has seen more than $2 trillion worth of valuation disappear as the price of bitcoin, ether and most other cryptocurrencies has plunged. The early-May collapse of the Terra platform erased $60 billion worth of tokens and started a chain reaction through hedge funds like Three Arrows Capital Ltd. and lenders like Celsius Network LLC, Voyager Digital Ltd., and BlockFi Inc.

Vauld, which has about 800,000 users mainly in Asia, was the latest party to experience trouble. On Monday, it suspended withdrawals, disclosing that users had pulled almost $200 million over the past three weeks. The company had laid off 30% of its staff and said it was looking into its alternatives, including a restructuring.

Founded in 2018, Vauld raised $25 million in Series A funding last summer, attracting funds from Valar Ventures, which was founded by billionaire Peter Thiel, as well as Pantera Capital and Coinbase Ventures, a unit of the publicly listed U.S. crypto exchange.

In a release about the deal, Nexo, which operates out of Switzerland and has about four million users, compared current conditions to the U.S. banking crisis of 1907, a time before the creation of the Federal Reserve when markets didn't have a so-called lender of last resort.

That panic subsided only after J.P. Morgan and associates injected private capital in the market. Recently, the billionaire Sam Bankman-Fried has made a number of deals that have drawn the comparison to Morgan. Nexo put itself in that category as well.

The market, Nexo said, "is again in the hands of a few capable and well-capitalized entities to come up with systemic solutions and aid the sector."

The price of bitcoin on Tuesday was up 0.4% at $19,603. It is down 71% from its November high of $67,802.

Write to Paul Vigna at Paul.Vigna@wsj.com
